item.title: Episode 428 - Java and Spring Apps
item.description: Our resident expert on all things Java on Azure, Asir Vedamuthu Selvasingh, gives us all the latest updates on running your Java workloads on various Azure services. He also dives into the newly renamed Azure Spring Apps service which now has more SKUs to address various use-cases.

item.title: Amazon launches CodeWhisperer, a GitHub Copilot-like AI pair programming tool – TechCrunch
item.description: At its re:Mars conference, Amazon today announced the launch of CodeWhisperer, an AI pair programming tool similar to GitHub’s Copilot that can autocomplete entire functions based on only a comment or a few keystrokes. The company trained the system, which currently supports Java, JavaScript …
item.author: (Frederic Lardinois@fredericl / 9:23 AM PDT•June 23, 2022comment Comment)

item.title: rustc_typeck::collect - Rust
item.description: “Collection” is the process of determining the type and other external details of each item in Rust. Collection is specifically concerned with inter-procedural things – for example, for a function definition, collection will figure out the type and signature of the function, but it will not visit the body of the function in any way, nor examine type annotations on local variables (that’s the job of type checking).

item.title: When is a product "done" and what do you do next?
item.description: Some teams continue building new features and improvements to products without stepping back and considering whether it makes sense to stop When is a product considered good enough or done? And what should a team do once it’s done? In this post I share a common framework I use to help answer this question and evaluate relevant tradeoffs.
item.author: (Kashish Hora)

item.title: Style scoping versus shadow DOM: which is fastest?
item.description: Last year, I asked the question: Does shadow DOM improve style performance? I didn’t give a clear answer, so perhaps it’s no surprise that some folks weren’t sure what conclusion …

item.title: Why Nobody is Happy with Hybrid
item.description: Meetings where people are co-located and streaming on Zoom are the WORST. It sounds terrible, no one who isn't there can understand you, and I have no idea who is talking. Glad the people in the office are having a good time
item.author: (https://www.facebook.com/mzagaja)

item.title: A journey into the Linux scheduler
item.description: Two years ago more or less I started my journey in Linux. I was scared at first and I didn’t know where to start from. But then I decided to buy a book - and what a book! - in order to follow a path. Along the way, I integrated the material with up-to-date documentation from kernel.org and source code. In the meantime, I started to learn C a bit so that I also could have played with what I was learning, step by step.

item.title: What every new software developer should know
item.description: The tech landscape changes dramatically every 5-10 years. And we poor software developers have to constantly run and re-skill just to catch up. Was it always like this?
item.author: (Bhavesh Kakwani)
